intro: Anthericum baeticum, commonly known as the Baetican rush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Alismataceae and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in dense, spike-like clusters. It thrives in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in wetlands and along streams. Anthericum baeticum is notable for its ecological importance in supporting local biodiversity.
